architectural_notes: When positioning/moving the “No” button randomly, clamp X/Y coordinates to viewport bounds minus button width/height so the element never renders off-screen.
known_issues: “No” button can move partially/completely off-screen, becoming unclickable; movement must be constrained within viewport including button dimensions.

existing_features.title: Fix the Valentine Opening Screen “No” button movement so the button’s rendered bounding box always remains completely within the visible viewport (no partial off-screen placement), accounting for the button’s current width/height and any dynamic viewport changes (resize/orientation/zoom/mobile browser UI). The button must remain fully visible and clickable at all times, and every random reposition must be strictly constrained within the viewport boundaries.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix: Constrain “No” button random movement so it always remains fully within the visible viewport (account for button size) and stays clickable

projectName: Fully constrain “No” button random movement to always stay inside viewport
